content: The Ark Brought from Kirjath Jearim(A)
Then David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds,  with every leader.

And David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If  good to you, and if it is of the  our God, let us send out to our brethren everywhere  left in all the land of Israel, and with them to the priests and Levites  in their cities  their common-lands, that they may gather together to us;
and let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we have not inquired at it since the days of Saul.”
Then all the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
So David gathered all Israel together, from Shihor in Egypt to as far as the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjath Jearim.
And David and all Israel went up to Baalah, to Kirjath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God the , who dwells  the cherubim, where  name is proclaimed.
So they carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab, and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
Then David and all Israel played  before God with all  might, with singing, on harps, on stringed instruments, on tambourines, on cymbals, and with trumpets.
And when they came to Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.
Then the anger of the  was aroused against Uzza, and He struck him because he put his hand to the ark; and he died there before God.
And David became angry because of the ’s outbreak against Uzza; therefore that place is called Perez Uzza to this day.
David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the ark of God to me?”
So David would not move the ark with him into the City of David, but took it aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months. And the  blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all that he had.
